channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: Obesity drugs’ next wave: These companies could snag 20% of GLP-1 market, analysts say
item.description: While Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk dominate the obesity-drug market, there’s a vast field of would-be competitors closing in behind them — and the most ...

item.title: SharkNinja Is Coming for Your Home
item.description: The company’s vacuums, blenders and other appliances have been taking over kitchens and homes. It isn’t done yet.

item.title: NFL to vote on private-equity team ownership, reports say
item.description: Pro football league may allow private-equity firms to own up to 10% of a team.

item.title: Crypto Bros Aren't Flipping Watches. That Is an Issue for Luxury Brands.
item.description: It is becoming less lucrative to speculate on luxury watches, which has a knock-on effect in brands’ stores.

item.title: ‘I’m conflicted’: I have two sons — one is a hard worker with kids and the other is a ‘carefree’ actor. Should I leave the ‘family man’ more money in my will?
item.description: “The money could be going to my grandkids.”

item.title: This Reviled Pharmaceutical Firm Holds Promise of a Healthier Future
item.description: A short seller’s report raised concerns about Barcelona-based Grifols this year, but a selloff seems overdone.

item.title: SolarEdge’s stock reverses lower as CEO steps down after 5 years in the role
item.description: SolarEdge’s stock reversed course to trade sharply lower Monday, after the solar-power-equipment maker said its chief executive of the past five years...

item.title: CrowdStrike's Big Mystery: How Bad, and for How Long?
item.description: The cybersecurity provider’s second-quarter results might shed limited light on fallout from the global outage caused by its minor software update.

item.title: ‘We don’t want his daughter to lose out’: My late son named his brother, who is a minor, as beneficiary on his life-insurance policy. How do we rectify this?
item.description: ‘His brother is a minor, but my son also had a baby daughter who was not named on the policy’
